image.altText: A collection of beanies displayed on a wall.

props.synopsis: An intricate hot air balloon beanie and a woolly hat made entirely from dog fur are among the almost 7,000 creations on display at this year's Alice Springs Beanie Festival.

title.children: In the outback, 7,000 beanies — and one made of dog fur — are stealing the show

image.altText: A large piece of equipment on the port.

props.synopsis: The founder of two major new marine infrastructure projects in Western Australia is weighing up a bid for the Darwin Port.

title.children: Australian business considering bid for embattled Darwin Port

image.altText: police auxilary liquor inspector uniform on man in street

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has been slammed over a plan to grant transit and public housing safety officers "quasi-policing powers", including authority to carry guns on buses, in supermarkets and public housing.

title.children: NT compared to US under Trump over plans to arm public 'quasi-police'

image.altText: Land clearing NSW

props.synopsis: Investigations are under way into satellite images the Australian Conservation Foundation says are proof farmers across Australia have illegally cleared 900 square kilometres of native habitat in five years.

title.children: Conservation group compiles 'shocking' evidence of mass habitat loss

image.altText: Drone shot of eleven fuel tanks next to harbour

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government was unaware for almost two years that 11 massive US military fuel tanks were being built unlawfully on Darwin Harbour, it has been revealed during NT budget estimates.

title.children: Unlawful build of US military fuel tanks in Darwin 'a mess', minister says

image.altText: A man with glasses sits with his arms crossed and resting on a grand piano.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's pre-eminent opera maestros, best known for reorchestrating the ABC's radio news theme, will soon lead the Darwin Symphony Orchestra — with grand plans to take the community ensemble to the world.

title.children: Celebrated maestro to take Darwin orchestra's 'potential' to the world

image.altText: A termite mound in Central Australia

props.synopsis: Native title holders of a vast Central Australian cattle station have taken their fight against the NT's largest-ever water licence to the High Court, further delaying a development some hope will be a lifeline for a struggling region.

title.children: Legal battle over NT's largest water licence escalates to High Court

image.altText: A white man, dark brown hair wearing a navy suit, orange tie sitting in a leather chair in front of teal wall.

props.synopsis: The Country Liberal Party committed to a 43 per cent reduction in emissions by 2030 leading into last year's NT election, which it won from opposition. The environment minister now says that target will not be implemented.

title.children: NT government says it will not implement 2030 emissions reduction target

image.altText: A hornbill looks through the bars of a cage. Others are visible in the background.

props.synopsis: The exotic pet industry is booming, fuelled by global demand for rare parrots, reptiles and other wild creatures — but in Solomon Islands, one of the Pacific's most active wildlife trading hubs, it is under growing scrutiny.

title.children: Plucked from a forest, sent to a cage: Behind the global exotic pet trade

image.altText: Red wine being poured into several glasses, on top of a wine barrel

props.synopsis: Red wine varieties like shiraz decline in popularity while consumers opt for low-alcohol and sweeter wines like moscato.

title.children: Are Australians falling out of love with shiraz?

image.altText: A heater on the floor with two feet warming up next to it. The feet have socks on

props.synopsis: Tourists are stunned to discover they were warmer back in a country that's blanketed by snow for months of the year.

title.children: Even visitors from snowy countries realise Australian winters feel too cold

image.altText: Jim Chalmers responds to ABC Leaders Debate, federal election 20

props.synopsis: There was no mistaking the impression that the treasurer is emboldened by the election result and wants to seize his moment.

title.children: Jim Chalmers wants to pick a fight on tax — and time is of the essence

image.altText: an edited photo showing man in an orange search jacket and a woman with long blond hair, with forest in the background

props.synopsis: It's been two years since tourist Celine Cremer disappeared without a trace in a Tasmanian rainforest, but high-profile private investigator Ken Gamble is certain she is within a 1km radius of where her phone last "pinged".

title.children: Investigator believes phone data holds answers for missing Belgian

image.altText: A man in a suit looking at the camera and pointing with his palm.

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin says that in his view the whole of Ukraine is "ours" and cautions that advancing Russian forces could take the Ukrainian city of Sumy as part of a bid to carve out a buffer zone.

title.children: Putin explains belief that 'the whole of Ukraine is ours'

image.altText: A woman sleeps with a quilt on against a blue backdrop

props.synopsis: Felt like staying in bed longer this morning? It might be because the shorter days are affecting your circadian rhythm.

title.children: It's the shortest day of the year. Here's how that might be affecting your sleep

image.altText: A group of swimmers doing a nude solstice dip.

props.synopsis: Thousands of people have celebrated the shortest day of the year by taking a nude plunge in the freezing waters of Hobart.

title.children: Around 3,000 go nude for 'energising' winter solstice dip in Hobart

image.altText: Land clearing NSW

props.synopsis: Investigations are under way into satellite images the Australian Conservation Foundation says are proof farmers across Australia have illegally cleared 900 square kilometres of native habitat in five years.

title.children: Conservation group compiles 'shocking' evidence of mass habitat loss

image.altText: A newborn baby is shown lying down, with one of its feet in the foreground of the image.

props.synopsis: Queensland police have finalised their investigation into a Brisbane couple's international surrogacy case with no charges laid. Surrogacy advocates say the case shows Australia's are outdated.

title.children: Couple who allegedly used overseas surrogate for baby won't be charged

image.altText: Image of UK military plane inside a base that has been damaged and spray painted with red paint by Pro-Palestinian activists

props.synopsis: British defence minister John Healey ordered an investigation and a review of wider security at the country's military bases.

title.children: Pro-Palestinian activists break into UK military base and damage planes

image.altText: Power lines connecting pylons of high-tension electricity and a billboard-sized figure of a bull at sunset

props.synopsis: The extraordinary failure of Spain's entire electricity system in April sparked furious debate over the energy transition. But what caused the blackout?

title.children: Spain's blackout shows 'we're not reacting fast enough' to changing grids

image.altText: Tech start-up founder Julian Fayed with new staff member Tien Hung Nguyen.

props.synopsis: While overall employment is holding up, there are increasing signs that artificial intelligence is eating away at opportunities in some parts of the job market, especially for entry-level white-collar work.

title.children: 'This is going to be very, very disruptive': Employers issue warning on AI

image.altText: The front of the protest line with the National Guard shields on full display.

props.synopsis: A US appeals court lets Donald Trump retain control on Thursday of California's National Guard while the state's Democratic governor proceeds with a lawsuit challenging the Republican president's use of the troops to quell protests in Los Angeles.

title.children: Trump can keep control of National Guard in LA, appeals court rules

image.altText: Chris Brown in a suit walks in front of another man.

props.synopsis: Grammy-winning singer Chris Brown pleaded not guilty on Friday to a charge related to the serious beating of a music producer with a bottle in a London nightclub in 2023.

title.children: Chris Brown pleads not guilty to beating music producer in nightclub

image.altText: A person stands on the deck of a ship holding a white balloon in the air there is a large ice block and water in the background.

props.synopsis: Scientists are venturing to the Southern Ocean to study clouds and the world's cleanest air to better understand climate change and the impact of human activity on the Earth's atmosphere.

title.children: Pristine Antarctic clouds hold clues to climate model blind spots

image.altText: A woman milks a cow at a farm in India

props.synopsis: As India prepares to count its population and redraw the boundaries of its parliamentary constituencies, some states are pleading for their people to have more children.

title.children: Indian politicians offer cows and cash to encourage baby making

image.altText: A graphic showing a plane superimposed over the top of a blue background with germs on it

props.synopsis: As COVID-19 surges again in popular overseas holiday destinations in Asia, how can you stay healthy when travelling internationally?

title.children: With COVID cases surging in South-East Asia, here's how to stay safe

image.altText: An older man in high vis shakes the hand of a paramedic, there is an upturned silo in the background

props.synopsis: Vaughan Mason's quick thinking saved the life of a farmer trapped and struggling to breathe in a grain silo. Now, the pair have reunited.

title.children: Paramedic awarded highest honour after risky grain silo rescue

image.altText: Archival photo underground miners Mount Isa

props.synopsis: It's almost impossible to picture this outback mining city without its stacks, but that could be the future.

title.children: As Australia's deepest copper mine calls time, what happens to Mount Isa?

image.altText: Argentina players celebrate

props.synopsis: The British and Irish Lions showed glimpses of class but ultimately not enough as Argentina recorded a thrilling 28-24 victory in Dublin ahead of the nine-match tour of Australia.

title.children: Lions fall to 54-year first ahead of Australia tour

image.altText: Angel Di Maria shouts and runs away to celebrate a goal against Auckland at the Club World Cup.

props.synopsis: Auckland City go down 6-0 to Benfica after a weather delay, leaving them with no wins, no goals and 16 conceded in two games at the Club World Cup.

title.children: 'A little disappointed': Auckland concedes 16 goals in two games

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair wearing a baby pink scarf stands at the edge of an inland waterway smiling.

props.synopsis: When masters student Kinneret Pezarkar moved to Canberra from Mumbai, she found making friends a challenge despite being surrounded by other students who had left their support networks behind.

title.children: 'Persistent loneliness' in a city full of people looking for friends

image.altText: Shriya Lohia sits on a racing car and gives the thumbs up.

props.synopsis: They're young, fast and fearless. These are the teenage girls making waves in India's male-dominated motorsport circuits.

title.children: These young Indian women are shifting gears on what's expected

props.synopsis: The Brisbane centre is facing an uncertain future because the building it's in will go up for sale next month, and it'll be the fifth time they've been forced to move in 10 years.

title.children: A clinic saving the lives of refugees facing an uncertain road ahead

image.altText: Police officers and vehicles behind tall palms on a hot-looking street.

props.synopsis: Police vow to "leave no stone unturned" in their search for answers after a woman's body was found on a Townsville street.

title.children: Police declare crime scene after woman's body found on busy street

image.altText: A man and woman slumping on their seats inside an airport

props.synopsis: Australians who were in Bali during a 2017 volcano eruption emphasise the importance of taking out travel insurance, following news of Mount Lewotobi Laki-Laki's eruption.

title.children: Australians in Bali during last volcano eruption back travel insurance
